meanings.definition: Relating to an archduke or archduchess.
meanings.sent1: The grand ballroom was decorated in an archducal style, fit for royalty.
meanings.sent2: The archducal family hosted a lavish banquet for visiting dignitaries.
meanings.sent3: The archducal cat strutted around the palace as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: Her archducal manners and grace captivated all who met her.
meanings.sent5: The archducal crown sparkled with precious gems, a symbol of power and authority.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to the rank of archduke or archduchess.
meanings.sent1: The archducal title was bestowed upon him by the king for his loyalty.
meanings.sent2: The archducal residence overlooked the vast kingdom below.
meanings.sent3: The archducal carriage rolled through the streets, drawing admiration from the townsfolk.
meanings.sent4: His archducal lineage traced back to ancient times, filled with tales of valor and honor.
meanings.sent5: The archducal portrait hung proudly in the gallery, a reminder of past glory.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of an archduke or archduchess.
meanings.sent1: The archducal attire was adorned with intricate embroidery and fine lace.
meanings.sent2: The archducal gardens were a serene retreat for the noble couple.
meanings.sent3: The archducal laughter echoed through the palace, bringing joy to all.
meanings.sent4: Her archducal charm and wit charmed even the most stoic of guests.
meanings.sent5: The archducal portrait captured the essence of regal elegance in brushstrokes.
